Code As Manuscript

Writing your code and analyses as if it was the manuscript.

Home About GPS Lessons GitHub

© 2015. All rights reserved.

Dynamic report generation using R Markdown and knitr

Learning expectations

  • How to write reproducible reports
  • How to write in markdown
  • How to set the report options
  • How to make tables and figures in the report

5 main concepts:

  • Markdown syntax: # or ##, *, **, ![](), ` ``` , \, >, -, @, []()
  • YAML: output, word_document, html_document, bibliography
  • Options: echo, eval, message, warning, error, fig.height, fig.width, results, fig.cap
  • Tables and figures: pander, kable, ggplot, qplot, captioner
  • Generate the report: knitr, render, ‘Knit HTML’ or ‘Knit Word’ button (RStudio)
